etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 奧(奧) (ào) = semantic element of making a sound + phonetic element -> expression "oh"
etymology.interpretation: The character 噢 combines the mouth radical 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") indicating vocalization with the phonetic element 奧(奧) (ào) to express realization or acknowledgment, similar to saying "oh" in English.

examples.chinese: 噢(噢)，我忘记带钥匙了(我忘記帶鑰匙了)。
examples.pinyin: Ō, wǒ wàngjì dài yàoshi le.
examples.english: Oh, I forgot to bring my keys.

examples.chinese: 噢(噢)，这真令人惊讶(這真令人驚訝)。
